thread.title: Rangers notes: Nothing for Nash - Hockey
thread.title_full: Rangers notes: Nothing for Nash - Hockey - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: Rangers notes: Nothing for Nash - Hockey
text:
Nothing for Nash 
Left wing Rick Nash has now gone without a goal through the first five games, making it the longest season-opening drought of his career.
Still, he had four shots on net, three attempts blocked and one shot miss the net in 17:18.
"I feel good, I just can’t hit the back of the net," Nash said after Thursday’s 3-0 loss at Montreal. "There’s more we could have done, there were a lot of shots from the outside. I definitely think there’s some frustration. We have to simplify now. A lot of our offense comes off our defense."
Mixing it up 
For the first time this season, coach Alain Vigneault switched up his line top three line combinations, trying to find some offensive spark in the third.
J.T. Miller replaced Nash on Derick Brassard’s left wing with Mats Zuccarello, Nash went on Derek Stepan’s right wing with Chris Kreider and Kevin Hayes, who had been on Stepan’s right wing, reverted to his last season’s role of third-line center with rookie Oscar Lindberg shifting to left wing and Viktor Stalberg on the right.
Still, the Rangers were outshot, 13-7, in the third period.
Line change 
Emerson Etem, 23, played 7:09 and was a minus-1 without a shot in his Rangers’ debut, playing on fourth-line center Dominic Moore’s left wing along with Jesper Fast.
"I try to put a positive spin on things," said Etem, acquired in the off-season from the Ducks for Carl Hagelin, of being a healthy scratch the first four games. "It gave me a chance to see what the guys do in different situations so I took it as a time to build my game and build my knowledge."
Veteran Jarret Stoll was a healthy scratch for the first time this season.
— Andrew Gross
